subject: p19016834
History: Status post dilation of esophageal stricture.
Findings: There is no pneumothorax or pneumomediastinum. The cardiomediastinal silhouette is normal. A small right pleural effusion is unchanged. Since the prior radiograph, there has been increased nodular peribronchial opacification, most readily explained by chronic aspiration. Mild hazy opacification at the left base is unchanged and likely represents chronic atelectasis.
Impression: No pneumothorax or pneumomediastinum. Increasing peribronchial opacification at the right base likely represents aspiration, possibly pneumonia.
